name: Patato
title: Fried Potato Cakes
ingredient: 1 onion, quartered with the root intact
1/4 teaspoon of freshly ground black pepper
preparation:
1. In a large colander, grate the potatoes and onion coarsely, alternating between the two. Squeeze the mixture to remove as much liquid as possible and place it in a large bowl. Add the egg, flour, salt, and pepper, and mix.

2. Pour enough vegetable oil into a large skillet to cover the wall to a height of about 1/2 inch (1 cm) and heat over medium heat. Using a spoon, put about 1/4 cup (60 ml) of the potato mixture for each cake. Gently press the cakes with a fork to flatten them (leaving a space of about 1 inch/2.5 cm between each one). Cook for 5 to 6 minutes or until the cakes are golden brown and the edges are crispy (flip them halfway through cooking). Drain on a plate lined with paper towels. Cook the rest of the potato mixture in the same way.

(You can prepare the cakes in advance, place them on a rack, cover them with paper towels, and let them cool. They will keep for up to 2 hours at room temperature. To reheat, remove the paper towels, place the rack on a baking sheet, and bake at 350°F/180°C for 10 minutes or until heated through.)

name: Brocoli
title: Garlic Roasted Broccoli
preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). 

2. In a large bowl, toss the broccoli florets with the minced garlic and olive oil until well coated. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

3. Arrange the broccoli florets in a single layer on a baking sheet. Roast in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until tender and slightly charred. 

4. Serve hot.

name: Cauliflower
title: Cauliflower Curry
preparation:
1. Heat the vegetable oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until softened, about 5 minutes. 

2. Add the minced garlic and grated ginger to the pot and sauté for another minute. 

3. Add the curry powder to the pot and stir to combine with the onion mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. 

4. Add the cauliflower florets to the pot and stir to coat with the curry mixture. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

5. Pour in the can of coconut milk and stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer, then reduce the heat to low and cover the pot. Let the curry simmer for 20-25 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender. 

6. Serve the curry hot over a bed of rice.

name: Carrots
title: Honey Glazed Carrots
preparation:
1. In a large saucepan, bring water to a boil. Add sliced carrots and cook for 5 minutes or until just tender. Drain and set aside. 

2. In the same saucepan, melt butter over medium heat. Add honey, ginger, salt, and pepper, stirring well. 

3. Add the cooked carrots to the honey mixture and stir to coat well. Cook, stirring occasionally, for 5-10 minutes, or until the carrots are glazed and tender. 

4. Serve hot.

name: Bell Peppers
title: Stuffed Bell Peppers
preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). 

2. In a large bowl, mix together the ground beef, uncooked rice, diced onion, diced tomatoes (undrained), Italian seasoning, salt, and pepper until well combined. 

3. Stuff each bell pepper half with the beef and rice mixture, packing it in tightly. 

4. Arrange the stuffed bell peppers in a baking dish and cover with foil. 

5. Bake in the preheated oven for 45-50 minutes, or until the peppers are tender and the filling is cooked through. 

6. Remove the foil from the baking dish and sprinkle the shredded cheddar cheese over the top of each stuffed pepper. Return the dish to the oven and bake for an additional 5-10 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. 

7. Serve hot.

name: Celery
title: Cream of Celery Soup
preparation:
1. In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, melt the butter over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and celery and sauté until the vegetables are soft, about 10 minutes. 

2. Stir in the flour and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring constantly. 

3. Gradually add the chicken or vegetable broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps. Bring the soup to a boil and then reduce the heat to low. 

4. Simmer the soup for 20-30 minutes, or until the celery is tender and the soup has thickened. 

5. Remove the soup from the heat and let it cool slightly. Puree the soup in batches in a blender until smooth. 

6. Return the soup to the saucepan or Dutch oven and stir in the heavy cream. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

7. Reheat the soup over low heat before serving.

name: Zucchini
title: Zucchini Fritters
preparation:
1. In a large bowl, combine the grated zucchini, all-purpose flour, grated Parmesan cheese, chopped fresh parsley, beaten egg, salt, and black pepper. Stir until well combined. 

2. Heat a large skillet over medium heat and add enough vegetable oil to cover the bottom of the skillet. 

3. Drop spoonfuls of the zucchini mixture into the skillet and cook until golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side. 

4. Remove the zucchini fritters from the skillet and place them on a paper towel-lined plate to absorb excess oil. 

5. Serve hot.

name: Cucumber
title: Cucumber Salad
preparation:
1. In a large bowl, combine the thinly sliced cucumbers, thinly sliced red onion, and chopped fresh dill. 

2. In a separate bowl, whisk together the olive oil, white wine vinegar, honey, salt, and black pepper until well combined. 

3. Pour the dressing over the cucumber mixture and toss to coat. 

4. Chill the cucumber salad in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes before serving. 

5. Serve cold.

name: Mushroom
title: Mushroom Risotto
preparation:
1. In a large saucepan, heat the chicken or vegetable broth over medium heat. Keep the broth warm. 

2. In a separate large saucepan or Dutch oven, melt 2 tablespoons of the unsalted butter with the olive oil over medium heat. 

3. Add the sliced mushrooms and cook until they are tender and have released their liquid, about 5-7 minutes. 

4. Remove the mushrooms from the saucepan with a slotted spoon and set them aside. 

5. Add the remaining tablespoon of unsalted butter to the saucepan and add the finely chopped onion. Cook the onion until it is soft and translucent, about 5 minutes. 

6. Add the Arborio rice to the saucepan and stir to coat the rice with the butter and onion mixture. Cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly. 

7. Pour in the dry white wine and stir until it has been absorbed by the rice. 

8. Add the warm chicken or vegetable broth to the saucepan, 1/2 cup at a time, stirring constantly and allowing each addition to be absorbed before adding the next. 

9. Cook the risotto until it is tender and creamy, about 20-25 minutes. 

10. Stir in the reserved cooked mushrooms and grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

11. Serve hot.

name: Spinach
title: Spinach and Feta Stuffed Chicken Breasts
ingredient: 4 cups fresh spinach leaves, washed and dried
preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). 

2. Using a sharp knife, cut a pocket into the side of each chicken breast, being careful not to cut all the way through. 

3. In a small bowl, combine the spinach leaves, crumbled feta cheese, chopped sun-dried tomatoes, chopped kalamata olives, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. 

4. Stuff each chicken breast with the spinach and feta mixture. 

5. Heat the olive oil in a large oven-safe skillet over medium-high heat. 

6. Sear the stuffed chicken breasts in the skillet until they are golden brown on both sides, about 2-3 minutes per side. 

7. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and no longer pink in the center. 

8. Serve hot.

name: Lettuce
title: Grilled Chicken Salad with Avocado and Tomato
preparation:
1. Preheat the grill or a grill pan to medium-high heat. 

2. Brush the chicken breasts with 1 tablespoon of the olive oil and season with salt and pepper. 

3. Grill the chicken for 6-7 minutes per side, or until cooked through. Remove from the grill and let rest for 5 minutes. 

4. In a large bowl, combine the chopped lettuce leaves, sliced avocado, cherry tomatoes, chopped red onion, and chopped fresh cilantro. 

5. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the remaining tablespoon of olive oil, lime juice, honey, salt, and pepper. 

6. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. 

7. Slice the grilled chicken breasts and add them to the salad. 

8. Serve immediately.

name: Khale
title: Kale and Chickpea Salad with Lemon Vinaigrette
ingredient: 1 bunch kale, stems removed and chopped
preparation:
1. In a large bowl, combine the chopped kale, chickpeas, chopped red onion, crumbled feta cheese, dried cranberries, and chopped walnuts. 

2. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the olive oil, fresh lemon juice, Dijon mustard, honey, salt, and pepper. 

3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. 

4. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic
title: Garlic and Herb Green Beans
ingredient: 1 pound fresh green beans, washed and trimmed
1 tablespoon chopped fresh herbs (such as rosemary, thyme, or parsley)
preparation:
1. Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the green beans and cook for 2-3 minutes, or until they are tender but still slightly crisp. Drain and set aside. 

2. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the minced garlic and chopped fresh herbs and sauté for 1-2 minutes, or until fragrant. 

3. Add the cooked green beans to the skillet and toss to coat with the garlic and herb mixture. 

4. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

5. Serve immediately.

name: Asparagus
title: Lemon Garlic Roasted Asparagus
preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 

2. In a large bowl, combine the trimmed asparagus, minced garlic, olive oil, fresh lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Toss to coat evenly. 

3. Arrange the asparagus in a single layer on a baking sheet. 

4. Roast in the preheated oven for 10-12 minutes, or until the asparagus is tender and slightly browned. 

5. Serve immediately.

name: Radish
title: Radish and Cucumber Salad with Yogurt Dressing
ingredient: 1 bunch radishes, trimmed and sliced thin
preparation:
1. In a large bowl, combine the sliced radishes, sliced cucumber, and chopped fresh parsley. 

2. In a separate small bowl, whisk together the plain Greek yogurt, extra-virgin olive oil, fresh lemon juice, honey, salt, and pepper. 

3. Pour the dressing over the salad and toss to coat. 

4. Serve immediately.

name: Tomato
title: Caprese Salad with Tomatoes, Mozzarella, and Basil
preparation:
1. On a large platter, arrange the sliced tomatoes and mozzarella cheese in an alternating pattern. 

2. Sprinkle the chopped fresh basil over the top. 

3. Drizzle the extra-virgin olive oil over the salad. 

4. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 

5. Serve immediately.

name: Eggplant
title: Baba Ghanoush
preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 400°F. 

2. Using a fork, pierce the eggplant several times to allow steam to escape during cooking. Place the eggplant on a baking sheet and roast in the preheated oven for 35-40 minutes, or until the skin is charred and the flesh is tender. 

3. Allow the eggplant to cool slightly, then cut it in half lengthwise and scoop out the flesh into a large bowl. Discard the skin. 

4. Add the minced garlic, tahini, lemon juice, ground cumin, salt, and pepper to the bowl with the eggplant flesh. Mix well. 

5. Drizzle the olive oil over the top and garnish with chopped fresh parsley, if desired. 

6. Serve with pita bread or vegetables for dipping.

name: Onion
title: French Onion Soup
preparation:
1. In a large pot, melt the unsalted butter over medium heat. 

2. Add the sliced onions and cook, stirring frequently, for 25-30 minutes, or until the onions are caramelized and tender. 

3. Add the beef broth, water, dry white wine, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the pot with the onions. Bring to a simmer and cook for 10-15 minutes. 

4. Preheat the broiler. 

5. Place the slices of French bread on a baking sheet and broil for 1-2 minutes, or until lightly toasted. 

6. Ladle the soup into oven-safe bowls and place a slice of toasted French bread on top of each bowl. Sprinkle the shredded Gruyere cheese over the bread. 

7. Broil the soup for 3-5 minutes, or until the cheese is melted and bubbly. 

8. Serve immediately.

name: Garlic
title: Garlic Sauce
preparation:
1. In a small bowl, mix together the minced garlic, mayonnaise, lemon juice, salt, and black pepper. 

2. Cover the bowl and refrigerate the garlic sauce for at least 30 minutes before serving. 

3. Serve the garlic sauce with your favorite dish, such as grilled chicken or roasted vegetables.

name: Sweet potato
title: Roasted Sweet Potatoes
ingredient: 2 large sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
preparation:
1. Preheat the oven to 425°F. 

2. In a large bowl, mix together the sweet potato cubes, olive oil, salt, black pepper, garlic powder, and paprika. 

3. Spread the sweet potato mixture in a single layer on a baking sheet. 

4. Roast the sweet potatoes in the preheated oven for 20-25 minutes, stirring occasionally, or until they are tender and lightly browned. 

5. Serve the roasted sweet potatoes as a side dish with your favorite meal.
